name: Execute CP/M 2.2 programs on Windows
short_description:
This program allows old 8 bit CP/M 2.2 applications to be run on Windows machines, up to Windows 8.1 64 bits.
The idea is to have the CP/M application run from its own folder, which will be presented to the application as drive A:
I wrote this program to allow me to run UCD MicroMumps natively on Windows, which seems to be working fine.
Then I tested with Microsoft Basic as well, and a few other apps.
There is no terminal emulation, so applications like Wordstar and Supercalc will not run correctly.
The code is still work in progress and was written mostly over sleepless nights, so there may be bugs.

RunCPM will look for a CPM22.BIN on its own folder and sub folders called A, B, C and so on, which will be treated ad each disk drive.
Just load those "disk drives" with software and off you go.

This project provides the core for my other project: http://sourceforge.net/projects/cpmduino
summary: Emulates the CP/M 2.2 BIOS and BDOS calls inside the command prompt
